articles.author: Olena Harmash, Aleksandar Vasovic
articles.description: Senior Ukrainian officials visited Washington seeking U.S. support against Russia, as Kyiv showed its ability to fight on by setting off an explosive device under a bridge that has become a symbol of the Kremlin's claims on Ukrainian territory.
articles.title: Zelenskiy aides visit US as Ukraine strikes Russian-held territory

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Crispian Balmer
articles.description: At least 27 Palestinians were killed and dozens wounded by Israeli fire near a food distribution site in the southern Gaza Strip, local health authorities said, in the latest bout of chaos and bloodshed to plague the aid operation.
articles.title: At least 27 Palestinians killed near Gaza aid site, medics say

articles.author: Jack Kim
articles.description: South Koreans will elect a new president on Tuesday to cap six months of turmoil triggered by a shock martial law briefly imposed by former leader Yoon Suk Yeol that marred the country's reputation as a vibrant, if at times chaotic, democracy.
articles.title: South Koreans vote for president after months of turmoil triggered by martial law

articles.author: Francois Murphy, John Irish
articles.description: U.N. inspectors monitoring Iran's Fordow nuclear site confronted a major gap in their knowledge last year as they watched trucks carrying advanced uranium-enriching centrifuges roll into the facility dug into a mountain south of Tehran.
articles.title: Any Trump deal with Iran must tackle nuclear watchdog's blind spots

articles.author: Stephanie Van Den Berg, Bart Meijer
articles.description: Dutch far-right leader Geert Wilders toppled the ruling coalition on Tuesday, gambling that a snap election focused on immigration will bring victory at the polls and secure his decades-old ambition of holding the highest political office.
articles.title: Populist Wilders breaks Dutch coalition to push immigration agenda in elections

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian drone attacks and shelling knocked out electricity substations, Russia-installed officials said.
articles.title: At least 700,000 people in Russian-held Ukraine without power after Ukrainian strikes, officials say

articles.author: Tom Balmforth, Milan Pavicic
articles.description: Satellite imagery of a Russian air base taken shortly after Ukraine carried out a drone attack deep inside Russia over the weekend shows several strategic bombers were destroyed and badly damaged, according to three open source analysts.
articles.title: Satellite imagery shows Ukraine attack destroyed and damaged Russian bombers

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States will scale down its military presence in Syria to one base from eight and U.S. policies will shift in the country "because none of them worked" over the last century, the new U.S. special envoy has said.
articles.title: US to scale down its military bases in Syria, envoy says

articles.author: Alexandra Valencia
articles.description: Ecuador's national assembly legislature on Tuesday backed a constitutional reform that would allow the installation of foreign military bases in the South American country, part of plans by President Daniel Noboa to increase cooperation to fight drug trafficking.
articles.title: Ecuador legislature backs reform allowing foreign military bases

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia and Ukraine have shared blueprints for a peace deal that demonstrate how far apart the warring parties are.
articles.title: How do Ukraine's and Russia's peace terms differ?
